description: 2-hour written examination covering all course topics with emphasis on latter half of material. Includes problem-solving on differential geometry, topology of curves/surfaces, and classification of surfaces. Hurdle requirement: 50% needed to pass course.
Individual written assignment covering first five weeks of lectures (differential curves/surfaces, fundamental forms). Provided in Week 7 and due in Week 9.
45-minute test in Week 5 assessing initial course material. Includes problem-solving and stating definitions/theorems from differential geometry of curves/surfaces.
